sentences: Ulrich Wild is an American record producer, engineer and mixer specializing in the rock and metal genres.
Born and raised in Switzerland, Ulrich is now a naturalized citizen in the United States, living in Los Angeles, California.

In a career that has spanned over 20 years, his numerous credits include producing or engineering albums for bands such as Dethklok (a virtual metal band), Sex Slaves, Project 86, Pantera, Here Comes the Kraken, Static-X, Otep, Stabbing Westward, Powerman 5000, Deftones, Seether, Bleeding Through, Breaking Benjamin, Taproot, SOiL, World Entertainment War, and many other artists, and for soundtracks including Freddy vs. Jason, Mission: Impossible 2, and House of Wax.
He has also remixed songs by the band Mindless Self Indulgence.
He was nominated for a Grammy for best engineered non-classical album  in 1995 for his work with White Zombie.
Fishbone – Give a Monkey a Brain and He'll Swear He's the Center of the Universe (engineered)
Gary Glitter – I'm the Leader of the Gang (I Am) (Green Jellÿ cover)
White Zombie – Airheads (song: Feed the Gods)
White Zombie – Nativity in Black (song: Children of the Grave)
White Zombie – Beavis and Butt-head Do America (song: Ratfinks, Suicide Tanks and Cannibal Girls)
Fu Manchu – The Action Is Go
Janes Addiction – Kettle Whistle (song: So What!)
The Union Underground – ...An Education in Rebellion
Stone Temple Pilots – Thank You (song: All in the Suit that you wear)
2003: Bleeding Through – This Is Love, This Is Murderous
Stutterfly – And We Are Bled of Color
2006: Mindless Self Indulgence – Shut Me Up (remix)
2008: Mindless Self Indulgence – Never Wanted to Dance (remix)
Evolution – Evolution (record, engineer and mix for the Otep Shamaya performance on the song "Change")
2011 Thousand Foot Krutch – Live at the Masquerade (mixed)
Sex Slaves – Call of the Wild
Emilie Autumn – Fight Like A Girl
Brendon Small – Brendon Small's Galaktikon II
